thread.title: Coaches' Corner: UMD Hockey's Scott Sandelin
thread.title_full: Coaches' Corner: UMD Hockey's Scott Sandelin

title: Coaches' Corner: UMD Hockey's Scott Sandelin
text:
Coaches' Corner: UMD Hockey's Scott Sandelin 
By Zach Schneider October 7, 2015 Updated Oct 7, 2015 at 1:18 PM CDT 
Duluth, MN (NNCNOW.com) --- The University of Minnesota Duluth (UMD) men's hockey team is ranked No. 2 in the nation and was picked by media to win the National Collegiate Hockey Conference (NCHC), and those preseason expectations were a main part of the discussion in this week's "Coaches' Corner" with head coach Scott Sandelin. 
This conversation is part of the weekly show "Bulldog Country," which covers all things UMD and airs every Friday night at 6:30 p.m. on the My 9 Sports Network. 
Click here to subscribe to our daily newsletter. 
No. 2 UMD will officially open the season this weekend with a home-and-home series against Bemidji State. The Friday night game is scheduled for 7:07 p.m. at AMSOIL Arena, and it can be seen live in the Northland on the My 9 Sports Network.
